str:Codelist.com:Name: Derivation Type
str:Codelist.com:Description: This codelist identifies the specific method used to derive a new data element or indicator from source data, such as raw data, IMF staff calculations, IMF staff estimates, or IMF staff projections.

str:Code.com:Name: Staff estimates using group mean imputation methods
str:Code.com:Description: Staff estimates using group mean imputation methods.

str:Code.com:Name: Staff estimates using historical imputation methods
str:Code.com:Description: Staff estimates using historical imputation methods.

str:Code.com:Name: Raw data (no derivation)
str:Code.com:Description: Non-transformed data (also called original data) refers to data in its original form, before any mathematical or statistical operations have been applied to change its values or distribution.

str:Code.com:Name: IMF Staff calculations (derived value)
str:Code.com:Description: Data that results from direct calculations or transformations performed on raw data by IMF staff. These calculations are usually straightforward and transparent, with the published numbers easily traceable back to the source data.

str:Code.com:Name: IMF Staff calculations (derived from counterpart data)
str:Code.com:Description: Data resulting from direct application of counterpart data by IMF staff to the official information reported by other countries.

str:Code.com:Name: IMF Staff estimates
str:Code.com:Description: Data derived through calculations or transformations on available source data, where some necessary information might be missing. In these cases, IMF staff uses estimates to fill in the gaps and produce the published numbers.

str:Code.com:Name: IMF Staff projections
str:Code.com:Description: Forecasts of future values for a time series, constructed using various techniques such as statistical modeling, trend analysis, and expert judgment. These projections are based on historical data, current economic conditions, and other relevant factors.

str:Code.com:Name: Mixed-type data
str:Code.com:Description: Data that combines both raw and derived data. This could occur when some components of a dataset are directly reported while others are calculated or estimated.

str:Code.com:Name: Reported official data
str:Code.com:Description: Official data reported to the IMF by country authorities without any modifications or adjustments made by IMF staff.

str:Code.com:Name: Reported official data converted to US dollar
str:Code.com:Description: Official data reported to the IMF by country authorities in a country's domestic currency, which IMF staff then converts to US dollars using appropriate exchange rates.

str:Code.com:Name: Adjusted using Fund records
str:Code.com:Description: Official data reported to the IMF by country authorities that has that have been adjusted using internal IMF records.
